home.title: Scholars of the South Tigris Solo Helper
home.play1: Play Scholars of the South Tigris solo against the AI.
home.play2: This application replaces scheme cards, manages most of the AI player board and guides you through the game and solo ruleset. It supports all difficulty levels.
home.play3: You can also play with the Body of Books expansion.

instructions.intro: Setup the game for a 2-player game, with the following changes for the AI:
instructions.soloBoard: Give your opponent the Solo Board instead of a Player Board.
instructions.influenceOrangeGuild: Place {count} Influence in the Orange Guild.
instructions.influencePurpleGuildScrollCard: Place {count} Influence on the Scroll Card in the Purple Guild.
instructions.influenceScrollCardNeutralMarker: Place {count} Influence on the Scroll Card adjacent to the Neutral Marker.
instructions.goldOnLeftMostTranslatorCount: Place 1 Gold on the left-most neutral Translator. | Place 1 Gold on each of the 2 left-most neutral Translators.
instructions.startingScrollCard: They start with a random {language} Scroll Card from the reserve. Place it facedown above the associated language as printed across the top of the Solo Board, without any further effect.
instructions.researchMarkers: Rather than placing their Research Markers on the Main Board, keep them nearby the Solo Board.
instructions.researchMarkersBodyOfBooks: Place your opponent’s Research Markers on the Main Board Extension. Each Research Marker should be placed directly below a different Page Card.
instructions.noSchemeCards: The AI does not need the action cards or scheme cards - the scheme card deck and the "Dice Sum" track is managed by this application.
instructions.xpFirstCaliphSpace: Place only 1 XP on the first Caliph Card space.
instructions.firstPlayerMarker: Give yourself the First Player Marker. You can play either the Casual or Epic version of the game.
instructions.noFurtherSetup: Do not give your opponent any other player components. They do not select a Starting Translator or Resource Card. Instead, all Neutral Translators belong to your opponent, but there is no need to place Influence on them.

turnPlayer.title: Player
turnPlayer.playerPaySilver: Silver you paid to the AI:

general.requireEmployedTranslators: The action can only be executed, if there are at least {count} Employed Translators.
general.requireScrollCardsHouseOfWisdom: The action can only be executed, if there are at least {count} Scrolls Cards in the House of Wisdom.
general.influence1AnyBonus: The AI places influence on a Guild. They will focus on a Guild where no players have any Influence. If there are multiple options available, they will decide between those options by selecting the Guild where they have no Influence. If there are still multiple options, they will decide between those options using their colour focus.
general.influenceBonus: The AI places the depicted influence on a Guild.
general.silverBonus: The AI gains the depicted amount of silver (managed by the application).

influenceCard.title: Influence Card
influenceCard.houseOfWisdomScrolls: The AI influences a scroll card. They focus on the House of Wisdom first:
influenceCard.mapScrolls: If all Scrolls in the House of Wisdom already have Influence on them, they will focus on the Map:

translate.title: Translate
translate.translate: The AI will translate a scroll form the House of Wisdom:
translate.languageFocus: Use their language focus to select a scroll card.
translate.lowestRow: If there are multiple options available, they will decide between those options by selecting the Scroll Card that is in the lowest row in the House of Wisdom.
translate.guildFocus: If there are still multiple options, they will decide between those options using their colour focus.
translate.placeCard: After Translating a Scroll Card, place it facedown above the matching language printed on the Solo Board. Then place up to a number of Gold from the Main Supply as indicated by the Gold icon below the language on the Solo Board.

placeGold.title: They will aim to place the required number of Gold, while never placing more than 1 Gold during the same Translation action on a single Translator. When placing Gold, follow these steps:
placeGold.neutralTranslatorsLanguage: Place onto Neutral Translators who can speak the Scroll Card’s language, moving from right to left across the Main Board.
placeGold.translatorsLanguage: Place onto your Translators who can speak the Scroll Card’s language, moving from left to right across the Main Board. You receive 1 Silver for each.
placeGold.neutralTranslators: Place onto Neutral Translators who cannot speak the Scroll Card’s language, moving from right to left across the Main Board.
placeGold.translators: Place onto your Translators who cannot speak the Scroll Card’s language, moving from left to right across the Main Board. You receive 1 Silver for each.

travel.title: Deliver a Scroll Card
travel.deliverScroll: They deliver a Scroll form the Map:
travel.languageFocus: Use their language focus, looking clockwise around the Map, starting from the Neutral Marker.
travel.neutralMarkRelation: While they do not move the Neutral Marker, they act as if they would have, just like you moving your Player Marker. As such, they won’t target the Scroll Card adjacent to the Neutral Marker, unless they do a full loop around the Map.
travel.placeCard: When Delivering their chosen Scroll Card, they will aim to place it into the highest row in the House of Wisdom. If there are multiple options available, they will decide between those options using their colour focus.
travel.influenceTwo: After Delivering, they will gain exactly 2 Influence in the Guild where they Delivered (independent of the row they delivery to).
travel.influenceDependingOnRow: After Delivering, they will gain either 1 or 2 Influence in the Guild where they Delivered (depending on the row they delivered to).

translatorEmploy.title: Employ Translator
translatorEmploy.chooseTranslator: Use their Translator focus when Employing a Translator, while trying to avoid Employing any duplicates across all Rooms (regardless of ownership). If all 6 Translators are already Employed, they will just Employ using their original focus despite them being a duplicate.
translatorEmploy.chooseRoom: They place the Translator into the right-most available Room according their room cost focus.
translatorEmploy.neutralTranslators: Since your opponent owns all Neutral Translators, there is no need to place their Influence on them. They ignore all costs and immediate effects from Rooms.

translatorPlaceGold.title: Place Gold on Translator
translatorPlaceGold.instruction: The AI places 1 Gold on the left-most neutral translator.

translatorRetire.title: Retire Translator
translatorRetire.instruction: The AI retires the pictured Translator from the top section of the Main Board.
